page.title: 14The pig farm.
page.content: On the pig farm there are 180 breeding sows, which are crossed large white and landrace. They are bred as lean bacon pigs. The sows breed all year and each sow produces about 20 piglets. The pigs are fed twice a day automatically with barley meal and soya products.The pigs eat 80 tons of meal a month. At 160 days old the pigs are sold to a firm in{Wolverhampton who make many kinds of pork products. The farm covers 2 acres. The average selling price for a pig over the year is Â£62. A vet visits regularly because there are many pig diseases and the farmer believes in prevention rather than cure. If visitors do come to the farm they must wear protective clothing to be allowed in. (H.Wood, L.Clark)
